comment._content: Henriette Caillaux (1874-1942) From Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henriette_Caillaux "Henriette Caillaux was a Parisian socialite and second wife of the former Prime Minister of France. She is remembered as an assassin. . . "Madame Caillaux believed that the only way for her husband [Joseph Caillaux, France's Minister of Finance] to defend his reputation would be to challenge [the editor of the Le Figaro newspaper Gaston] Calmette to a duel, which, one way or another, would destroy her and her husband's life. Madame Caillaux made the decision to protect her beloved husband by sacrificing herself. On 16 March 1914, the elegant and sophisticated woman walked to the newspaper's offices where she confronted the editor. After a few words, she pulled out a pistol and fired several shots point-blank into the man's chest, killing him instantly."
